folder: West 70th Street and Riverside, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1) The B.E.F. Camp Thomas Paine boasts its own country club, as herein shown. September 7, 1933. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing the club house. September 7, 1933. P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing an auto being prepared to take members of the B.E.F. at Camp Thomas Paine to the American Legion Convention in Oregon. September 3, 1932. P. L. Sperr.
title: Squatters Colony - Camp Thomas Paine.

text:

(2) The same, as No. 1, from a further angle. Fall 1932. P. L. Sperr.

folder: West 70th Street and Riverside, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
Squatters Colony, Camp Thomas Paine, Manhattan: A set of 3 views of this B.E.F. encampment of unemployed veterans on the Hudson River at the foot of West 75th Street. View No. 1 is northward across the New York Central Railroad tracks while Nos. 2 and 3 form a panoramic close-up. Across the background of all these views are the highlands of New Jersey.

September 29, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Squatters Colony - Camp Thomas Paine.

folder: West 70th Street and Riverside, Manhattan, N.Y.

title: Squatters Colony - Camp Thomas Paine.

folder: West 70th Street and Riverside, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1) A view of some of the shacks, which comprise Camp Thomas Paine, on Riverside Drive at about 75th Street.

September 7, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view.

September 7, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from another angle.

September 7, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Squatters Colony - Camp Thomas Paine.

folder: West 70th Street and Riverside, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
Squatters Colony, Camp Thomas Paine settled by veterans of the "Bonus Expeditionary Force," was organized along lines suggestive of military methods. Its Headquarters at 75th Street and the Hudson River are shown in this set of 3 views. The commander and staff, however, were chosen by the men, the work being done on a communal basis and the colony was notably clean and orderly in comparison with other squatter settlements. No. 1 shows the company headquarters; No. 2 the Company Street while No. 3 is eastward across the Supply Room.

September 7, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
(Not a dry mount item).
title: Squatters Colony - Camp Thomas Paine.

title: Squatters Colony - Camp Thomas Paine.

folder: West 70th Street and Riverside, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1) Camp Thomas Paine, on the banks of the Hudson River, at 75th Street and vicinity, an organization composed mostly of unemployed war veterans from New York City, with municipal consent. The camp is run somewhat like a Military post, and it has attracted quite some attention.
September 7, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view in the same vicinity.
September 7, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.

(3) The same, another view.
September 7, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.
